pullRequest.body:
Define singular cardinals and prove basic lemmas about them.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0e574a009b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17005/commits/0e574a009b82e572a720d625182b07c673fae837)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Regular`|765|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsRegular.not_isSingular`
`+ IsSingular`
`+ IsSingular.aleph0_le`
`+ IsSingular.cof_ord_lt`
`+ IsSingular.natCast_lt`
`+ IsSingular.not_isRegular`
`+ IsSingular.pos`
`+ card_ne_zero`
`+ card_pos`
`+ isRegular.of_not_isSingular`
`+ isRegular_or_isSingular`
`+ isRegular_or_isSingular_or_lt_aleph0`
`+ isSingular_aleph_iff`
`+ isSingular_aleph_omega`
`+ isSingular_iff_cof_lt`
`+ ord_ne_zero`
`+ ord_pos`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Looks good to me. I'd prefer if we first moved the stuff on regular ordinals out of the `Cardinal/Ordinal` file but I guess this can be done in either order.
Some golfing.
You can golf the file a bit by adding `variable {c : Cardinal}`.

```suggestion
  (nat_lt_aleph0 n).trans_le H.aleph0_le
```
I think we should instead have a more general `0 < c ↔ 0 < c.ord` lemma.
This section should be inside the cardinal namespace. That way you won't have to move it when you introduce the Regular section.
Can you prove this as `H.nat_lt 0`?
Not sure if this is needed given the iff, maybe it could just be an alias for the converse?
This should be a simp lemma in the opposite direction, and it'd be nice to add `=` and `≤` versions of it, as well as those for `Ordinal.card`.

Not sure the `≤` is that interesting 😁 

But yes please have `ord_pos`, `ord_eq_zero`, `ord_ne_zero`

> Not sure the `≤` is that interesting 😁
> 
> But yes please have `ord_pos`, `ord_eq_zero`, `ord_ne_zero`

Most of these already exist under different names (the `Ordinal.card` versions as well). The `card` positivity one is `Ordinal.zero_lt_card`. Should this be renamed or should the `ord` one be named similarly instead of `ord_pos`?

Edit: I'm renaming and deprecating `zero_lt_card`, let me know if this isn't right.

I think that should be renamed to `Ordinal.card_pos` too.

By the way, `ord_ne_zero` isn't actually needed, since `simp` simplifies `a ≠ b` to `¬ a = b` allowing it to use the `eq` theorems on `ne` statements. You can still add it if you think it's convenient for manual rewriting, though.
Yea I just won't make it a simp lemma.
You could also add the more general `IsLimit o → (aleph o).IsSingular ↔ o.cof < aleph o`.

```suggestion
theorem IsSingular.natCast_lt (H : c.IsSingular) (n : ℕ) : n < c :=
```

```suggestion
theorem IsRegular.of_not_isSingular (h : ℵ₀ ≤ c) (H : ¬c.IsSingular) :
```
Can you add a deprecation here?
But this is a theorem I added in this PR
Oops, my bad.
You just can't stop deprecating things, can you? 😔

```suggestion
  card_eq_zero.ne
```

```suggestion
  ord_eq_zero.ne
```

```suggestion
  rw [isSingular_aleph_iff omega0_isLimit, cof_omega0, ← aleph_zero, aleph_lt]
```

```suggestion
  constructor <;> intro h
  · have := h.cof_ord_lt
    rwa [aleph_cof ho] at this
  · exact (isSingular_iff_cof_lt (aleph0_le_aleph o)).mpr ((aleph_cof _) ▸ h)
```
This feels like it belongs right next to `IsRegular`. Would you mind either moving `IsSingular` to `SetTheory.Cardinal.Cofinality` or moving `IsRegular` to `SetTheory.Cardinal.Regular`?

I mentioned a bunch of comments ago that I'd like to move all the stuff about `IsRegular`, `IsStrongLimit`, and `IsInaccesible` to its own file, but that I thought it'd be fine to merge this PR first and then move those definitions to this file afterwards.
I tend to have the opposite opinion: split them first, then do this PR. This way, you don't have weird copyrights in the future
Do we really need the second lemma given that we have the first?

pullRequest.title: feat(SetTheory/Cardinal/Regular): define singular cardinals
